abstract.t: The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol for IPv6 (DHCPv6) enables DHCPv6 servers to pass configuration parameters. It offers configuration flexibility. If not secured, DHCPv6 is vulnerable to various attacks. This document analyzes the security issues of DHCPv6 and specifies the secure DHCPv6 mechanism for authentication and encryption of messages between a DHCPv6 client and a DHCPv6 server.
